title: Billy Thornton (rugby league)
text:
William Thornton (birth unknown – death unknown) was an English professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1930s and 1940s. He played at representative level for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a>, and at club level for <a href="Hunslet%20F.C.%20%281883%29">Hunslet</a>, as a , i.e. number 7.
Playing career.
International honours.
Billy Thornton won a <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a> for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> while at Hunslet in 1943 against Wales.
Championship Final appearances.
Billy Thornton played in <a href="Hunslet%20F.C.%20%281883%29">Hunslet</a>'s 8-2 victory over <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a> in the <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship">Championship</a> Final during the <a href="1937%E2%80%9338%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1937–38 season</a> at <a href="Elland%20Road">Elland Road</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 30 April 1938.
County Cup Final appearances.
Billy Thornton played in the <a href="Hunslet%20F.C.%20%281883%29">Hunslet FC</a>'s 7-13 defeat by <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> in the <a href="1929%E2%80%9330%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1929–30</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1929%E2%80%9330%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1929–30 season</a> at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 30 November 1929, in front of a crowd of 11,000.
